page.title: 04Daily Life Of Karen Ware
page.content: I get up at 07.30, dress and have a breakfast of cereal, toast and tea. My father takes my brother and I to school by 09.00. When the bell rings we enter the school, answer our names for the register and then assemble in the school hall for prayers and hymns. During the morning I do my work, and have playtime in the yard, playing a game of 'England Ireland' with friends. At 12.15 I have a school dinner of chips, meat with rice and squash to follow. In the afternoon we return to class to do more work, have another playtime and at 15.30 we go home. At home I play Lego with my brother or draw or read and do my homework. For tea I have cauliflower cheese, baked potatoes, peach slices and cream. I watch television until 20.30 and then wash, brush my teeth, comb my hair and go to bed.
